attribs.name: class_features
attribs.current:
Age. short-lived for gnomes. They mature at the same rate humans do and are considered full-grown adults by 25. They live 200 to 250 years, although hard toil and the dangers of the Underdark often claim them before their time.

Size. As to 3½ feet tall and weighs 80 to 120 pounds. Your size is Small.

Speed. Your base walking speed is 25 feet.

Superior Darkvision. 
Your darkvision has a radius of 60 feet.

Gnome Cunning. You have advantage on all
Intelligence, Wisdom, and Charisma saving throw against magic.

Tinker: 
You have proficiency with artisan's tools
(tinker's tools). Using those tools, you can spend 1 hour and 10 gp worth of materials to construct a Tiny clockwork device (AC 5, 1 hp). The device ceases to function after 24 hours (unless you spend 1 hour repairing it to keep the device functioning), or when you use your action to dismantle it; at that time, you can reclaim the materials used to create it. You can have up to three such devices active at a time.

Languages. You can speak, read, and write Common, Gnomish, and Undercommon.


Artificer's Lore: 
Whenever you make a (History) check related to magic items, alchemical objects, or technological devices, you can add twice your proficiency bonus, instead of any proficiency bonus you normally apply 

FEATURE: RESEARCHER
When you attempt to learn or recall a piece of lore, if you do not know that information, you often know where and from whom you can obtain it. Usually, this information comes from a library, scriptorium, university, or a sage or other learned person or creature, Your DM might rule that the knowledge you seek is secreted away in an almost inaccessible place, or that it simply cannot be found. Unearthing the deepest secrets of the multiverse can require an adventure or even a whole campaign.

ARCANE SCHEMA
You are able to 'learn' spell's schemas that you keep in your schema book. A schema differs from a spell in that a schema is the understanding needed to infuse the spell into a magic item but not to cast the spell itself. Therefore, you cannot cast the spell directly but are able to create scrolls with the spell on it. The knowledge also allows you to create items that have the prerequisite spell as a requirement for creation. Certain vocations also have the ability to infuse other items besides scrolls with the schema.
As with Infusion formulae schemas are not the same as arcane or divine spells, but is a more basic form of understanding magic that is inherent to both type of magic. Therefore, anything you create with your schemas will be neither arcane nor divine magic, and requires another artificer to understand the underlying schema.

You start with 5 + Intelligence ability modifier schemas in your schema book. All schemas must be below your Proficiency bonus (again - you can only copy these cantrips into scrolls and cannot cast them at will.) You can also copy the addition spells into your schema book by examining a scroll, a spell book, or schema book. This does not use up the scroll. Artificer's automatically know how to use any known spells as as schemas and does not need to keep schema of the spell in their schema book, this includes spells gained from multi-classing. Whenever another caster casts a spell that is not located in your schema book and is with your schema level range, as a reaction you can make an Arcane (Intelligence) check against the caster's spell DC. If successful you remember the details of spell and can add it to your schema book; however you can only remember one spell and until you've copied it, you are considered to be concentrating to hold the spell schema. If you attempt to remember a second spell before placing the first in your schema book, you will forget the first. Again, Learning such schemas does not give you that ability to cast it as a normal spell. 
Spells you have in your spellbook can be scribed into scrolls, wands, rods, staffs, etc as if you could cast them - baring in mind restrictions for level and total infusion points.

INFUSION POINTS
You are limited to certain amount of mystical energy you can use in day. This is your Infusion points. You maximum Infusion points is equal to your level in Artificer + your Intelligence modifier. At the dawn of each day or after a long rest your used infusion points be restored to refill your pool. In general, Infusions last 24 hours, until the Dawn of the next day. You may never have unexpended Infusion Points that exceeds the Maximum Infusions points for your level and ability.
Creating an Infusion costs a number of Infusion Points, as noted in the Infusion's description, and may cost money, also noted in the Infusion's Description. When an item is under the effect of an Infusion, that item is considered magical. The total number of Infusion Points invested in a single item or Automaton cannot exceed your Infusion Maximum.

ARTIFICER EXPERTISE
At 2nd level, choose two of your skill proficiencies based on Intelligence, one skill based on Intelligence and one tool
proficiency, or two tool proficiencies. Your proficiency bonus is doubled for any ability check you make that uses either of the
chosen proficiency.

UNRAVEL
At 3rd level, as a bonus action, you may use an infusion point to suppress an ongoing magical effect for 2 rounds. 
At 8th level, as a reaction you have become so attuned to the flow of magic you are able to effect such, you may use one infusion point to effectively ‘’dispel magic.’’ For magic being cast you must succeed an Arcana check to determine the spell - if you are successful spend one point and you may ‘’counterspell’’ as if a 4th level spell is being used if not then you spend 3 to attempt a counterspell 
At 12th level, you gain the advantage on the ability checks for dispelling, arcana checks, and for counterspell checks. For the sake of Counterspell such attempts are as if you use a 7th level spell slot.

RECHARGED
At 1st level, You may, as a bonus action, use 1 infusion point + 1 point per spell slot level to recharge a magic item with a single charge.
At 6th level, you reduce the infusion cost of making a wand, stave, rod by 1 point (You still may not exceed the Max Infusion cost)
At 12th level, if you put a charge into an item that broke as a result of expending its last charge, you may repair it. Rather than your overcharge granting an additional charge doesn't restore a charge, it returns the item's ability to gain more charges the next day. 
Alternate Rule: The Artifier must have one or all of the schema(s) necessary to recharge the item.

ENDURING ENCHANTMENT(This replaces the Enduring Enchantment received at 6ht level)
At 1st level, when you create an infusion you may choose to enhance the dweomer making it last more than one day. Doing so costs the Artificer dearly. In addition to the Infusion point costs the artificer reduces their Maximum Health by that same amount as well as take a point of Constitution damage. You may not regain the Infusion Point(s), CONstitution damage, and damage from Maximum HP until either the item(s) are broken, used or a week has passed. 
At 6th Level you may add infusions points to an Enduring Enchantment, taking it further - you may not add more Infusions points than your Maximum Infusion.
At 12th Level you no longer take Constitution damage when you craft an enduring enchantment.

EXPEDITIOUS ENCHANTER
At 5th level, you double your effective daily productivity from 25gp a day (DMG pg. 129) for magical goods to 50gp of work a day.; and from 5 gp a day for mundane to 15gp a day;
At 12th level, the daily magical productivity increases to 75 gp of work a day; Mundane is 50gp of work a day.
At 17th level, the daily magical productivity increases to 100gp of work a day; Mundane is 75gp of work a day.

attribs.name: flaws
attribs.current:
I follow orders, even if I think they're wrong.

I overlook obvious solutions in favor of complicated ones.

attribs.name: bonds
attribs.current:
My life's work is a series of tomes related to a specific field of lore.

I work to preserve a library, university, scriptorium, ar monastery.

attribs.name: personality_traits
attribs.current:
I ... speak ... slowly ... when talking to idiots, .
which ... almost ... everyone ... is compared to me.

I'm willing to listen to every side of an argument before I make my own judgment.

attribs.name: legendary_actions_display
attribs.current: The  can take 0 legendary actions, choosing from the options below. Only one legendary option can be used at a time and only at the end of another creature's turn. The  regains spent legendary actions at the start of its turn.
